file.title: Split without quotes count

p.text: Lets see how many parts can be divided into text, parts of which will be separated by a character or string. If during the search in the text to meet a piece of text, isolated quotes, then this piece is passed and the search it is not performed.

p.textAll: For example, if you break the text Hey, how ',' case, and? apart, indicating separation character ",". That text would break into 'hello' , 'how', 'case' and 'and?' . And the command will return you the number of these parts, in our case equal to 3. If you want to take any one part, then use the commando smash to pieces without the quotes .
